titleStmt.title: BNC-Baby: a sampling of the British National Corpus

respStmt.name: BNC Consortium (OUP, Longman, UCREL, OUCS, Chambers)

availability.para: This version of the British National Corpus is licenced for distribution by Oxford University Computing Services. Each copy of the corpus must include a copy of this corpus header and of the standard licence agreement. Any redistribution or republishing of the corpus texts (the "BNC Processed Material") is strictly forbidden.
For information, the conditions of the Standard License Agreement are as follows.

(a) The BNC Consortium grants according to the terms and conditions set out herein and in consideration of the payments specified herein a non-exclusive, non-transferable Licence to the Licensee to use the BNC Processed Material for the purposes of linguistic research and/or the development of language products.

(b) Distribution of the BNC Processed Material is restricted to the Licensee or in the event of the Licensee being an organisation, to the Licensee's research group. This group is defined as consisting only of those Licensee's employees whom the Licensee authorises to perform the work using the BNC Processed Material for the purposes described in paragraph (a).

(c) Members of the said research group must not, except as herein provided, copy, publish or otherwise give to any third party access to the whole or any part of the BNC Processed Material. It is the responsibility of the Licensee to ensure that the members of the said research group understand and abide by this restriction, and to supervise their activities with respect to the BNC Processed Material. Neither the Licensee nor members of the Licensee's said research group may assign, transfer, lease, sell, rent, charge or otherwise encumber the BNC Processed Material.

(d) The BNC Processed Material may be installed at the place or places of work of the said research group. The place of work is defined as the computing systems that the members of a research group normally use to conduct their research activities. It can include both work and home computers, and is not restricted to a particular machine or building.

(e) Copies of the BNC Processed Material may be made for backup purposes, or for the purposes of making data available to members of the research group but the Licensee shall ensure that the BNC Consortium's copyright notice is reproduced on all copies or parts thereof of the BNC Processed Material. Any such copies will be deemed to be part of the BNC Processed Material.

(f) There is no restriction on the use of the Licensee's Results except that the Licensee may not publish in print or electronic form or exploit commercially in any form whatsoever any extracts from the BNC Processed Material other than as permitted under the provisions of the relevant copyright laws.

(g) The BNC Consortium does not grant to the Licensee any rights whatsoever to reproduce the BNC Texts or use all or any part of the BNC Texts in commercial products or services in any way other than would be permitted under the fair dealings provision of copyright law.

sourceDesc.para: The British National Corpus has no single source document. For details of the source or sources used in the creation of each electronic text, see the individual text headers. The principles and practices underlying selection and design of the corpus are documented in the BNC User Reference Guide, a copy of which should be supplied with it.

projectDesc.para: The British National Corpus (BNC) Consortium was formed in 1990, and started work in 1991 on the three-year task of producing a hundred-million word corpus of modern British English for use in commercial and academic research. The first edition was published in 1994.

A second edition (the World Edition) was produced during between 1998 and 2000. It contains a thorough revision of the part of speech tagging, several corrections to the headers, and some minor revision of the SGML tagging used.
This edition is derived from the BNC World Edition but has been converted to use XML throughout, and also to include explicit lemmatization.

The BNC is the result of of a unique collaboration between three major U.K. dictionary publishers, two universities, and the British Library. The dictionary publishers are Chambers Harrap, Longman, and Oxford University Press; the universities are The Unit for Computer Research into the English Language (UCREL) at Lancaster University; and Oxford University Services (OUCS).

The development of the BNC was funded by the commercial partners in the consortium with assistance from the the U.K. government's Department of Trade and Industry (DTI) and Science and Engineering Research Council (SERC) under the Joint Framework for Information Technology (JFIT).

The British National Corpus is
A *large* corpus: its hundred million words are made up of ninety million from written and ten million from spoken sources.
A *sample* corpus: it is composed of text samples, generally of no more than 40,000 words, rather than of complete works.
A *synchronic* corpus: it includes imaginative texts dating from the 1960s to 1994; informative texts dating from 1975 to 1994; and spoken texts gathered primarily between 1990 and 1994.
A *general* corpus: it is not specifically restricted to any particular subject field, register or genre. It includes language from all age and social groups and a broad spread of U.K. regions.
A *monolingual* British English Corpus: text samples are substantially the product of British English speakers. A small proportion of the words in the corpus are in a foreign language or non-British English.
A *TEI-conformant* Corpus: texts in the corpus are uniformly marked up according to the recommendations of the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI), an international consortium concerned with the mark-up of texts for use in academic research. Originally expressed using Standardized General Markup Language (SGML; IS 8879:1986), the corpus is now encoded using XML.

Lexicography: The corpus provides a body of new data on word meaning, grammar and usage. It yields empirical data on word frequencies, word classes and spelling preferences, among other things. It also reveals hitherto undocumented evidence about the spoken language, with consequences that go far beyond the immediate impact on dictionary-writing.
Linguistic research: The corpus provides a standard basis for investigating phenomena and testing competing linguistic theories.

Language technology: Statistical techniques, requiring very large samples of text, are increasingly used in machine translation, speech recognition, speech synthesizers, spelling and grammar checkers for word-processing and desk-top publishing, hand-held electronic books and other developments in information technology.

Teaching: The corpus provides a rich source of examples of current usage for English Language Teaching, allowing more frequent patterns of use to be distinguished from less frequent. In addition, the corpus provides a valuable didactic resource for use in many areas of higher education.
As a model: Future TEI-conformant corpora, in English and other languages, may base their designs on the experience gained in the production of the BNC.

samplingDecl.para: Definitive information on the sampling policies applied during construction of the BNC is provided in the associated reference documentation. Different kinds of material were selected in different ways. Half the spoken material was chosen by a demographic sampling procedure, and the other half by sampling from predetermined contexts. Written material was selected randomly within the constraints of predetermined design criteria. The object was to maximize variation within each sampling frame.

editorialDecl.para: Material included in the BNC was produced by several different agencies and went through several pre- and post processing stages. An attempt has been made at consistency with respect to such matters as: treatment of perceived errors in the original (these are either silently corrected, or corrected with the <corr> element); treatment of end-of-line hyphenation (for the most part, end-of-line hyphenation has been removed); treatment of punctuation marks (all single or double quotation marks have been represented as <c> elements containing the appropriate Unicode character); segmentation into <s> ("sentence"), <mw> ("multiword"), <w>("word"), and <c> ("punctuation string") elements has been carried uniformly out across the whole corpus.

Material was originally prepared variously by copy-typing, scanning followed by OCR, and conversion from machine-readable sources. All material was processed to a common SGML format, and all subsequent processing, including addition of linguistic annotation, conversion to XML, and most error correction, was done using a wide range of software tools.

refsDecl.para: Canonical references to the BNC should be constructed by taking the value of the n attribute of the <bncDoc> element containing the target text, and concatenating a dot separator, followed by the value of the n attribute of the target <s> element containing the material to be referenced.
Segments are numbered sequentially within each text or stext, starting at 1. There may be gaps in the numeric sequence, as a consequence of post-segmentation corrections.

taxonomy.desc: David Lee's register and domain classification

xairaItem.desc: global attributes

attDef.desc: a name or number used to label any element

xairaItem.desc: (activity) contains a brief informal description of what a participant in a language interaction is doing other than speaking, if anything.

attDef.desc: level of spontaneity

xairaItem.desc: contains a postal or other address, for example of a publisher, an organization, or an individual.
specifies the age in years of a recorded participant at the time of the recording in which they participate.
marks an temporal alignment point within transcribed speech

attDef.desc: supplies an arbitrary identifier; all elements specifying the same value for this attribute are understood to be aligned with each other in time.

xairaItem.desc: (attribute definition) provides the definition for a single attribute.

attDef.desc: (namespace) specifies the namespace to which this attribute belongs
supplies a unique identifier.
supplies the namespace within which the identifier is to be found.

xairaItem.desc: contains documentation for all the attributes associated with this element, as a series of attDef elements.
specifies the indexing policy to be used for one or more attributes.

attDef.desc: supplies a unique identifier.
supplies the namespace within which the identifier is to be found.
identifies the attribute to which the indexing policy applies
specifies the required indexing policy

valItem.desc: no part of the attribute will be indexed
the attribute supplies an identifier which can be linked to from elsewhere
the value of the attribute is used as an identifier on some other element
the value of the attribute is used to supply a key for some predefined codebook or taxonomy of possible values

xairaItem.desc: in a bibliographic reference, contains the name of the author(s), personal or corporate, of a work; the primary statement of responsibility for any bibliographic item.

attDef.desc: main country of residence where known
internal identifier
year of birth where known

xairaItem.desc: supplies information about the availability of a text, for example any restrictions on its use or distribution, its copyright status, etc.
contains bibliographic description of a source text in the corpus, extracted from the text itself
(bibliographic citation) contains a loosely-structured bibliographic citation of which the sub-components may or may not be explicitly tagged.

attDef.desc: a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.

xairaItem.desc: (TEI corpus) contains the whole of a TEI encoded corpus, comprising a single corpus header and one or more TEI elements, each containing a single text header and a text.
contains a distinct document within the corpus, either spoken or written.
(character) contains a significant punctuation mark as identified by the CLAWS tagger.

attDef.desc: the CLAWS 5 code associated with this punctuation mark.

xairaItem.desc: (category description) provides a description for one category within the text taxonomies provided in the corpus header.
(category reference) provides a list of codes identifying the categories to which this text has been assigned, each code referencing a category element declared in the corpus header.

attDef.desc: identifies the categories concerned

xairaItem.desc: (category) defines a single category within a taxonomy of texts.
summarizes a particular change or correction made to a particular version of an electronic text which is shared between several researchers.

attDef.desc: supplies the date of the change in standard form, i.e. yyyy-mm-dd.
indicates the person, or group of people, to whom the element content is ascribed.

xairaItem.desc: (classCode) contains the classification code used for this text in some standard classification system.

attDef.desc: identifies the classification system or taxonomy in use.

xairaItem.desc: (classification declarations) contains one or more taxonomies defining any classificatory codes used elsewhere in the text.
supplies any additional ICU-conformant collating rules to be used when sorting words in the corpus.
(correction) contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text.

attDef.desc: contains verbatim text which has been corrected, or an empty string if the correction consists of an addition.
a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.
a code identifying the agency responsible for making the correction.

xairaItem.desc: contains information about the creation of a text.

attDef.desc: supplies the year of original composition, if known; or 000-00-00 if the date is unknown.

xairaItem.desc: contains a date in any format.

attDef.desc: supplies a standardized representation of the date

xairaItem.desc: specifies the default declared value for an attribute.
(description) contains a brief description of the purpose and application for an element, attribute, or attribute value.
contains an informal description of the regional variety of English used by a participant in a spoken text.
supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for the distribution of a text.
(text division) contains a subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.

attDef.desc: for a spoken text, identities the tape corresponding to this division.
specifies the hierarchic level of this division as a number between 1 (outermost or largest division) and 4 (innermost or smallest).
identifies the type or function of the division (for a written text).
a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.

xairaItem.desc: (Edition) describes the particularities of one edition of a text.

attDef.desc: supplies an identifying number for the edition

xairaItem.desc: (edition statement) groups information relating to one edition of a text.

(editor) secondary statement of responsibility for a bibliographic item, for example the name of an individual, institution or organization, (or of several such) acting as editor, compiler, translator, etc.

attDef.desc: supplies a number for the editor where multiple editors are specified for a single text

xairaItem.desc: (editorial practice declaration) provides details of editorial principles and practices applied during the encoding of a text.
specifies the xaira indexing policy to be used for one or more elements.

attDef.desc: identifies the element to which the indexing policy applies.
specifies the required indexing policy.

valItem.desc: no part of the element or its content will be indexed.
no part of the element will be indexed, but any child elements will be.
only the text and child content of the element will be indexed.
only the start and end tags for the element and any child elements not otherwise specified will be indexed.

xairaItem.desc: (Encoding description) documents the relationship between an electronic text and the source or sources from which it was derived.
(Event) any phenomenon or occurrence, not necessarily vocalized or communicative, for example incidental noises or other events affecting communication.

attDef.desc: provides a brief description of the event
(duration) indicates the duration of the element in minutes.

xairaItem.desc: specifies the approximate size of the text, in orthographic words, w elements, and s elements
(File Description) contains a full bibliographic description of an electronic file.
(omitted material) indicates a point where material has been omitted from the transcription.

attDef.desc: briefly describes the material which has been omitted.
gives further details of the reason for omission.
indicates the agency responsible for the intervention or interpretation, for example an editor or transcriber.

xairaItem.desc: (generic identifier) contains the name (generic identifier) of an element.

attDef.desc: supplies a unique identifier.
supplies the namespace within which the identifier is to be found.

xairaItem.desc: (heading) contains any type of heading, for example the title of a section, or the heading of a list, glossary, manuscript description, etc.

valItem.desc: a sub-heading providing the name of a journalist or other source of a newspaper report.

attDef.desc: a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.

xairaItem.desc: (highlighted) marks a word or phrase as graphically distinct from the surrounding text, for reasons concerning which no claim is made.

attDef.desc: a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.

xairaItem.desc: contains an identifier or name for an object of some kind in a formal language

attDef.desc: supplies a unique identifier.
supplies the namespace within which the identifier is to be found.

xairaItem.desc: (identifying number) supplies an identifying code for a text.

attDef.desc: categorizes the code number used.
categorizes the number, for example as an ISBN or other standard series.

xairaItem.desc: groups information relating to the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.

attDef.desc: internal identifier

xairaItem.desc: contains one component of a list.

attDef.desc: a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.

xairaItem.desc: supplies a list of element names carrying an attribute which has been specified with the xaira "joinTo" indexing policy.
(Keywords) contains a list of keywords or phrases identifying the topic or nature of a text.

attDef.desc: identifies the controlled vocabulary within which the set of keywords concerned is defined.

xairaItem.desc: (verse line) contains a single, possibly incomplete, line of verse.

attDef.desc: a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.

xairaItem.desc: contains the label associated with an item in a list; in glossaries, marks the term being defined.

attDef.desc: a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.

xairaItem.desc: specifies the label to be generated for the parent reference.

attDef.desc: specifies when the new label is to be generated.

valItem.desc: a new label is generated when a new instance of the scope-defining element is found, and remains in force until the next such element is found.
a new label is generated when a new instance of the scope-defining element is found, and remains in force until that instance ends.

xairaItem.desc: (language usage) describes the languages, sublanguages, registers, dialects etc. represented within a text.
characterizes a single language or sublanguage used within a text.

attDef.desc: Supplies a language code constructed as defined in RFC 3066 (or its successor) which is used to identify the language documented by this element, and which is referenced by the global xml:lang attribute.

xairaItem.desc: (line group) contains a group of verse lines functioning as a formal unit, e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.
contains any sequence of items organized as a list.

attDef.desc: a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.

xairaItem.desc: (locale) contains a brief informal description of the nature of a place for example a room, a restaurant, a park bench etc.
contains a multi-word unit as identified by CLAWS, that is, a sequence of individual tokens which function as a single unit and can be given a single part of speech code.

attDef.desc: supplies the CLAWS 5 code associated with this word.

valItem.desc: Adjective (general or positive) (e.g. good, old, beautiful)
General adverb: an adverb not subclassified as AVP or AVQ (see below) (e.g. often, well, longer (adv.), furthest.
Wh-adverb (e.g. when, where, how, why, wherever)
General determiner-pronoun: i.e. a determiner-pronoun which is not a DTQ or an AT0.
Existential there, i.e. there occurring in the there is ... or there are ... construction
Interjection or other isolate (e.g. oh, yes, mhm, wow)
Common noun, neutral for number (e.g. aircraft, data, committee)
Singular common noun (e.g. pencil, goose, time, revelation)
Plural common noun (e.g. pencils, geese, times, revelations)
Proper noun (e.g. London, Michael, Mars, IBM)
Indefinite pronoun (e.g. none, everything, one [as pronoun], nobody)
Personal pronoun (e.g. I, you, them, ours)
Reflexive pronoun (e.g. myself, yourself, itself, ourselves)
The possessive or genitive marker 's or '
Preposition (except for of) (e.g. about, at, in, on, on behalf of, with)
Unclassified items which are not appropriately considered as items of the English lexicon.
The present tense forms of the verb BE, except for is, 's: i.e. am, are, 'm, 're and be [subjunctive or imperative]
The past tense forms of the verb BE: was and were
The -ing form of the verb BE: being
The infinitive form of the verb BE: be
The past participle form of the verb BE: been
The -s form of the verb BE: is, 's
The finite base form of the verb BE: do
The past tense form of the verb DO: did
The -ing form of the verb DO: doing
The infinitive form of the verb DO: do
The past participle form of the verb DO: done
The -s form of the verb DO: does, 's
The finite base form of the verb HAVE: have, 've
The past tense form of the verb HAVE: had, 'd
The -ing form of the verb HAVE: having
The infinitive form of the verb HAVE: have
The past participle form of the verb HAVE: had
The -s form of the verb HAVE: has, 's
Modal auxiliary verb (e.g. will, would, can, could, 'll, 'd)
The finite base form of lexical verbs (e.g. forget, send, live, return) [Including the imperative and present subjunctive]
The past tense form of lexical verbs (e.g. forgot, sent, lived, returned)
The -ing form of lexical verbs (e.g. forgetting, sending, living, returning)
The infinitive form of lexical verbs (e.g. forget, send, live, return)
The past participle form of lexical verbs (e.g. forgotten, sent, lived, returned)
The -s form of lexical verbs (e.g. forgets, sends, lives, returns)
The negative particle not or n't
Alphabetical symbols (e.g. A, a, B, b, c, d)
Probably AJ0 (adjective), but maybe NN1 (singular noun)
Probably AJ0 (adjective), but maybe VVD (verb past tense)
Probably AJ0 (adjective), but maybe VVG (-ing verb)
Probably AJ0 (adjective), but maybe VVN (verb past participle)
Probably AVP (adverb particle), but maybe PRP (preposition)
Probably AVQ (wh- adverb), but maybe CJS (subordinating conjunction)
Probably CJS (subordinating conjunction), but maybe AVQ (wh- adverb)
Probably CJS (subordinating conjunction), but maybe PRP (preposition)
Probably CJT ("that" as conjunction), but maybe DT0 (determiner)
Probably CRD (number), but maybe PNI (indefinite pronoun)
Probably DT0 (determiner), but maybe CJT ("that" as conjunction)
Probably NN1 (singular noun), but maybe AJ0 (adjective)
Probably NN1 (singular noun), but maybe NP0 (proper noun)
Probably NN1 (singular noun), but maybe VVB (verb)
Probably NN1 (singular noun), but maybe VVG (-ing verb)
Probably NN2 (plural noun), but maybe VVZ (-s verb)
Probably NP0 (proper noun), but maybe NN1 (singular noun)
Probably PNI (indefinite pronoun), but maybe CRD (number)
Probably PRP (preposition), but maybe AVP (adverb particle)
Probably PRP (preposition), but maybe CJS (subordinating conjunction)
Probably VVB (verb), but maybe NN1 (singular noun)
Probably VVD (verb past tense), but maybe AJ0 (adjective)
Probably VVD (verb past tense), but maybe VVN (verb past participle)
Probably VVG (-ing verb), but maybe AJ0 (adjective)
Probably VVG (-ing verb), but maybe NN1 (singular noun)
Probably VVN (verb past participle), but maybe AJ0
Probably VVN (verb past participle), but maybe VVD (verb past tense)
Probably VVZ (-s verb), but maybe NN2 (plural noun)

xairaItem.desc: (name, proper noun) contains a proper noun or noun phrase.
supplies a list of element names or attribute identifiers
supplies the formal name of the namespace to which the elements documented by its children belong.

attDef.desc: the full formal name of the namespace concerned.

xairaItem.desc: contains a note or annotation.

attDef.desc: internal identifier

xairaItem.desc: contains an informal description of a person's trade, profession or occupation.
(paragraph) marks paragraphs in prose.

attDef.desc: indicates how the paragraph is displayed
a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.

xairaItem.desc: contains descriptive text appearing within components of a TEI header
(participation description) describes the identifiable speakers, voices, or other participants in a linguistic interaction.

attDef.desc: internal identifier

xairaItem.desc: a pause either between or within utterances.

attDef.desc: (duration) indicates the duration of the element in minutes.

xairaItem.desc: (page break) marks the boundary between one page of a text and the next in a standard reference system.

attDef.desc: gives the number of the page beginning here

xairaItem.desc: (personal name) contains a proper noun or proper-noun phrase referring to a person, possibly including any or all of the person's forenames, surnames, honorifics, added names, etc.
contains any additional information supplied about a participant in a spoken text
provides information about an identifiable individual, for example a participant in a language interaction, or a person referred to in a historical source.
(place name) contains an absolute or relative place name.
supplies page numbers for a bibliographic citation.

(text-profile description) provides a detailed description of non-bibliographic aspects of a text, specifically the languages and sublanguages used, the situation in which it was produced, the participants and their setting.

(project description) describes in detail the aim or purpose for which an electronic file was encoded, together with any other relevant information concerning the process by which it was assembled or collected.
contains the name of the place where a bibliographic item was published.
(publication statement) groups information concerning the publication or distribution of an electronic or other text.
provides the name of the organization responsible for the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.
(quotation) contains a phrase or passage attributed by the narrator or author to some agency external to the text.

attDef.desc: a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.

xairaItem.desc: (recording event) details of an audio or video recording event used as the source of a spoken text, either directly or from a public broadcast.
(recording statement) describes a set of recordings used in transcription of a spoken text.
(references declaration) provides documentation for the reference system applicable to the corpus.
(relationship) describes any kind of relationship or linkage amongst a specified group of participants.

attDef.desc: identifies the active participants in a non-mutual relationship, or all the participants in a mutual one.
supplies a list of participants amongst all of whom the relationship holds equally.
supplies a name for the kind of relationship of which this is an instance.
identifies the passive participants in a non-mutual relationship.

xairaItem.desc: contains a phrase describing the nature of a person's intellectual responsibility.

(statement of responsibility) supplies a statement of responsibility for someone responsible for the intellectual content of a text, edition, recording, or series, where the specialized elements for authors, editors, etc. do not suffice or do not apply.
(revision description) summarizes the revision history for a file.
(s-unit) contains a sentence-like division of a text.

attDef.desc: sequence number

xairaItem.desc: (sampling declaration) contains a prose description of the rationale and methods used in sampling texts in the creation of a corpus or collection.
(setting) describes one particular setting in which a language interaction takes place.
(setting description) describes the setting or settings within which a language interaction takes place, either as a prose description or as a series of setting elements.
(Shift) marks the point at which some paralinguistic feature of a series of utterances by any one speaker changes.

attDef.desc: specifies the new state of the paralinguistic feature specified.

xairaItem.desc: supplies a description of the source text(s) from which an electronic text was derived or generated.
(speech) An individual speech in a performance text, or a passage presented as such in a prose or verse text.

attDef.desc: indicates the person, or group of people, to whom the element content is ascribed.

xairaItem.desc: A specialized form of heading or label, giving the name of one or more speakers in a dramatic text or fragment.
(stage direction) contains any kind of stage direction within a dramatic text or fragment.

attDef.desc: a code briefly characterising the way the element content was originally presented.

xairaItem.desc: contains a single spoken text, i.e. a transcription or collection of transcriptions from a single source.

attDef.desc: specifies the type of spoken text.

xairaItem.desc: (tagUsage) supplies information about the usage of a specific element within a text.

attDef.desc: the name (generic identifier) of the element indicated by the tag.
specifies the number of occurrences of this element within the text.

xairaItem.desc: (tagging declaration) provides information about the XML elements actually used within a BNC text
(taxonomy) defines a typology used to classify texts either implicitly, by means of a bibliographic citation, or explicitly by a structured taxonomy.
(TEI Header) supplies the descriptive and declarative information making up an electronic title page prefixed to every TEI-conformant text.
contains a word or phrase used to describe the topic or nature of a text.
contains a single written text.

attDef.desc: specifies the type of written text.

xairaItem.desc: (text classification) groups information which describes the nature or topic of a text in terms of a standard classification scheme, thesaurus, etc.
contains the full title of a work of any kind.

attDef.desc: indicates the bibliographic level of this title

xairaItem.desc: (title statement) groups information about the title of a work and those responsible for its intellectual content.
supplies any additional ICU-conformant rules to be used when tokenization is performed by xaira rather than by explicit XML markup.
contains one or more truncated words in transcribed speech.
(utterance) a stretch of speech usually preceded and followed by silence or by a change of speaker.

attDef.desc: indicates the person, or group of people, to whom the element content is ascribed.

xairaItem.desc: contains a word, phrase, or passage which cannot be transcribed with certainty because it is illegible or inaudible in the source.

attDef.desc: (duration) indicates the duration of the element in minutes.

xairaItem.desc: (value definition) contains a single value and gloss pair for an attribute.

attDef.desc: supplies a unique identifier.
supplies the namespace within which the identifier is to be found.

xairaItem.desc: (value list) contains one or more valItem elements defining possible values for an attribute.

attDef.desc: supplies the identifier of a previously-defined value list to be used at this point
specifies the extensibility of the list of attribute values specified.

valItem.desc: (all the values specified should be supported, but other values are legal and software should have appropriate fallback processing for them. )
(the values specified are sample values only.)

attDef.desc: supplies a unique identifier.
supplies the namespace within which the identifier is to be found.

xairaItem.desc: specifies where the indexer is to find a value.

attDef.desc: supplies a unique identifier.
supplies the namespace within which the identifier is to be found.
indicates the kind of value to be found.

valItem.desc: content returned by one of the pseudo- functions count(), sysid(), or lineno()

attDef.desc: indicates whether the value required should be casefolded or not.

xairaItem.desc: (Vocalized semi-lexical) any vocalized but not necessarily lexical phenomenon, for example voiced pauses, non-lexical backchannels, etc.

attDef.desc: provides a brief description of the vocal event
(duration) indicates the duration of the element in minutes.
indicates the person, or group of people, to whom the element content is ascribed.

xairaItem.desc: (word) represents a grammatical (not necessarily orthographic) word.

attDef.desc: supplies a simplified part-of-speech code.
specifies the headword under which this lexical unit is conventionally grouped, where known.
supplies the CLAWS 5 code associated with this word.

valItem.desc: Adjective (general or positive) (e.g. good, old, beautiful)
General adverb: an adverb not subclassified as AVP or AVQ (see below) (e.g. often, well, longer (adv.), furthest.
Wh-adverb (e.g. when, where, how, why, wherever)
General determiner-pronoun: i.e. a determiner-pronoun which is not a DTQ or an AT0.
Existential there, i.e. there occurring in the there is ... or there are ... construction
Interjection or other isolate (e.g. oh, yes, mhm, wow)
Common noun, neutral for number (e.g. aircraft, data, committee)
Singular common noun (e.g. pencil, goose, time, revelation)
Plural common noun (e.g. pencils, geese, times, revelations)
Proper noun (e.g. London, Michael, Mars, IBM)
Indefinite pronoun (e.g. none, everything, one [as pronoun], nobody)
Personal pronoun (e.g. I, you, them, ours)
Reflexive pronoun (e.g. myself, yourself, itself, ourselves)
The possessive or genitive marker 's or '
Preposition (except for of) (e.g. about, at, in, on, on behalf of, with)
Unclassified items which are not appropriately considered as items of the English lexicon.
The present tense forms of the verb BE, except for is, 's: i.e. am, are, 'm, 're and be [subjunctive or imperative]
The past tense forms of the verb BE: was and were
The -ing form of the verb BE: being
The infinitive form of the verb BE: be
The past participle form of the verb BE: been
The -s form of the verb BE: is, 's
The finite base form of the verb BE: do
The past tense form of the verb DO: did
The -ing form of the verb DO: doing
The infinitive form of the verb DO: do
The past participle form of the verb DO: done
The -s form of the verb DO: does, 's
The finite base form of the verb HAVE: have, 've
The past tense form of the verb HAVE: had, 'd
The -ing form of the verb HAVE: having
The infinitive form of the verb HAVE: have
The past participle form of the verb HAVE: had
The -s form of the verb HAVE: has, 's
Modal auxiliary verb (e.g. will, would, can, could, 'll, 'd)
The finite base form of lexical verbs (e.g. forget, send, live, return) [Including the imperative and present subjunctive]
The past tense form of lexical verbs (e.g. forgot, sent, lived, returned)
The -ing form of lexical verbs (e.g. forgetting, sending, living, returning)
The infinitive form of lexical verbs (e.g. forget, send, live, return)
The past participle form of lexical verbs (e.g. forgotten, sent, lived, returned)
The -s form of lexical verbs (e.g. forgets, sends, lives, returns)
The negative particle not or n't
Alphabetical symbols (e.g. A, a, B, b, c, d)
Probably AJ0 (adjective), but maybe NN1 (singular noun)
Probably AJ0 (adjective), but maybe VVD (verb past tense)
Probably AJ0 (adjective), but maybe VVG (-ing verb)
Probably AJ0 (adjective), but maybe VVN (verb past participle)
Probably AVP (adverb particle), but maybe PRP (preposition)
Probably AVQ (wh- adverb), but maybe CJS (subordinating conjunction)
Probably CJS (subordinating conjunction), but maybe AVQ (wh- adverb)
Probably CJS (subordinating conjunction), but maybe PRP (preposition)
Probably CJT ("that" as conjunction), but maybe DT0 (determiner)
Probably CRD (number), but maybe PNI (indefinite pronoun)
Probably DT0 (determiner), but maybe CJT ("that" as conjunction)
Probably NN1 (singular noun), but maybe AJ0 (adjective)
Probably NN1 (singular noun), but maybe NP0 (proper noun)
Probably NN1 (singular noun), but maybe VVB (verb)
Probably NN1 (singular noun), but maybe VVG (-ing verb)
Probably NN2 (plural noun), but maybe VVZ (-s verb)
Probably NP0 (proper noun), but maybe NN1 (singular noun)
Probably PNI (indefinite pronoun), but maybe CRD (number)
Probably PRP (preposition), but maybe AVP (adverb particle)
Probably PRP (preposition), but maybe CJS (subordinating conjunction)
Probably VVB (verb), but maybe NN1 (singular noun)
Probably VVD (verb past tense), but maybe AJ0 (adjective)
Probably VVD (verb past tense), but maybe VVN (verb past participle)
Probably VVG (-ing verb), but maybe AJ0 (adjective)
Probably VVG (-ing verb), but maybe NN1 (singular noun)
Probably VVN (verb past participle), but maybe AJ0
Probably VVN (verb past participle), but maybe VVD (verb past tense)
Probably VVZ (-s verb), but maybe NN2 (plural noun)

xairaItem.desc: provides data needed to define one part of a xaira specification.

attDef.desc: supplies a unique identifier.
supplies the namespace within which the identifier is to be found.
indicates what is defined by this part of the specification.

valItem.desc: the reference used to identify a document in the corpus.
the default scope for results obtained from a corpus.
the reference used to identify some segmentation of a corpus document.
the indexing policy for some corpus component.
the default language for a corpus.
any additional tokenization or collation rules for some language used in a corpus.

xairaItem.desc: contains a list of xaira parameters of a particular type

attDef.desc: indicates the function of this part of the specification.

valItem.desc: lists and glosses the elements, attributes, and codebooks used in a corpus
specifies how items are to be indexed.
specifies any predefined ranges to be made available to the client.
specifies how items are to be referenced.

xairaItem.desc: specifies additional information needed by xaira.
defines the additional keys used to support filtering of text from different regions of selected texts

langUsage.language: The language of the British National Corpus is modern British English. Words, fragments, and passages from many other languages, both ancient and modern, occur within the corpus where these may be represented using a Latin alphabet. Long passages in these languages, and material in other languages, are generally silently deleted.

revisionDesc.change: add taxonomy descs and tax indexpol
Final manual check before delivery to OU; revised taxonomy definitions
Manually changed catdescriptions etc. for BNC-W
